summary: This bill, the 'Protecting Small Business Competitions Act of 2025,' aims to amend the Small Business Act. It focuses on codifying the 'Rule of Two,' which mandates that contracts exceeding a certain value be reserved for small businesses if the contracting officer anticipates receiving offers from two or more responsible small businesses at a fair market price. The bill was introduced in the Senate and referred to the Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship.
